results.title: The Pizzini Family
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, ACMI Content Development, Shelley Matulick and ACMI
results.brief_description: This is a story about an Italian-Australian family made unique by three generations of winemakers and master chefs. Meet Natalie, Alfred, Arnold, Katrina, Carla and matriarch Rosetta Pizzini, hear about the four brothers that immigrated to Australia and started farming tobacco, eventually diversifying to growing Italian variety grapes. The Pizzini’s make their own wine, run a cooking school and manage a boutique hotel in Whitfield, but still the most important part of their day is when they sit together and share a meal, a glass of wine and a laugh.

results.title: Game Masters: an evening with Tetsuya Mizuguchi
results.creator_credit: Jim Arneman, Mike Kenneally, ACMI Screen Events and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Join music gaming legend, artist and auteur, Tetsuya Mizuguchi, as he plays some of his seminal games and speaks about his signatory sound and visual fusion.

Famed for his pioneering application of music and visuals, Mizuguchi uses music not just as an accompaniment to a game, but as an integral part of its gameplay. Including traditional videogames, such as the hugely successful ‘Sega Rally Championship’, Mizuguchi has worked on some of the most original and unconventional music-fusion titles, including ‘Space Channel 5’, ‘Lumines’, ‘Rez’ and his latest opus, ‘Child of Eden’.

During this hosted conversation Mizuguchi explores how his vision has evolved over his career and demonstrates his pioneering application of music and visuals through live gameplay.

results.title: Game Masters: Rob Murray interview
results.brief_description:
In this interview, featured as part of the ‘Game Masters’ exhibition, Rob Murray speaks about his career as a game designer. Starting out as a solo developer for hire to becoming CEO of Firemint, Murray is one of the most successful indie game developers in existence.

Firemint’s success is due to Murray’s vision to create games such as ‘Flight Control’(2009) and’ Real Racing’ (2009), which are both easy to play and elegant and addictive in equal measure. In addition, his prescient reading of the drive towards personalised gaming, led by the ubiquity of social networking on mobile platforms, has kept his games on trend – ‘Flight Control’, for example, allows players to choose music from their personal libraries to accompany the game.

Rob talks about the rise of mobile based gaming and the development of ‘Flight Control’ and ‘Real Racing’ .

results.title: Ouyen's Roxy Theatre
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Roxy Theatre in Ouyen was under threat of becoming an abandoned ruin until the community stepped in to save it. Originally opened in 1936, it eventually became one of the only tropical theatres in the southern region of Australia but was closed in 1971 due to the actions of rowdy youths (according to local myth). After 36 years of closure, Jenny Heaslip took on the challenge of restoring the theatre and rallied over 250 local volunteers to help her. It is now an integral meeting point for the people of Ouyen not only because of fortnightly film screenings, but for community events, launches and celebrations. Run on a shoestring budget The Roxy continues to rely upon volunteers and community fundraising to stay alive.

results.title: Sustainable Ouyen
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Several years ago a group of Ouyen Primary School students petitioned their local council to adopt a community-recycling program. To everybody’s surprise the council not only provided an unprecedented household recycling service but did so at a loss. Since that time the community has launched a number of forward thinking initiatives with solar power, sustainable agriculture and improved water usage. Whether it’s the Ouyen Football Club, High School or local farmers, there’s an understanding that sustainable practices must be employed now in order for future Ouyen generations to benefit.

results.title: The Ouyen Taxi Driver
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: The town of Ouyen has only one taxi driver. Meet Ross Missen and see the town of Ouyen through his eyes, meet some of his regular customers and learn why locals love him.

results.title: Marion of Colignan
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Marion Peters loves living on the land. Despite having the opportunity of establishing a life in the city, she returned to her hometown to raise a family with her husband Geoff on a 12-hectare organic farm that they developed from scratch. Having overcome droughts, hailstorms and the large financial strain of maintaining a farm, Marion feels that things are finally looking up, with a bumper harvest of apples and promising yields of avocadoes and lemons. Marion is heavily involved in giving back to her community, pivotal in fundraising and ensuring community activities are maintained in a small town with a small population. She believes that it is vital for locals to stay involved and active within their own community.

results.title: Hooked on giving
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: A small but dedicated group of volunteers provide vital emergency service to their local community. Murray Allomes has been the team leader of the Nangiloc/Colignan Community Emergency Response Team (CERT) for 7 years. The small team of volunteers ensure that if an emergency takes place in their district assistance is provided quickly and with care. Despite the serious nature of their role within the community there’s always time for a laugh and a yarn about the strange and wonderful moments they encounter on the job.

results.title: Grapes and wine: a family tradition
results.creator_credit: Roberto Salvatore, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: Lance Milne is a third generation farmer in Nangiloc-Colignan. He and his wife Marina own a large vineyard in Nangiloc and diversified their business by purchasing one of Mildura’s oldest wineries, Château Mildura. They supply their own grapes and grow citrus. Lance is a passionate horticulturalist and is heavily involved in preserving the important history of wine growing in the Mildura region.

results.title: Sunraysia Ukulele Network
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, David Withers and ACMI
results.brief_description: An unlikely group of people come together once a month to share their love of the Ukulele. They meet on the last Sunday of each month at a local landmark called The Old Cottage where they play the uke and have a sing-a-long. Everyone is welcome, from beginners to more experienced players, the door is always open.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Csilla Csongvay, Matt Blackwood, David Withers and ACMI
